p.i: The House met at Eleven o'clock

speech.p: [Mr. SPEAKER in the Chair]

May I remind right hon. and hon. Members taking their Oaths that I intend to follow the pattern of yesterday, calling first on Front Benchers and Privy Councillors from both sides, and then hon. Members in whatever order they care to assemble.
I propose to suspend the Sitting at one o'clock, and to come back again at two o'clock.

p.i: The following Members took and subscribed the Oath, or made and subscribed the Affirmation required by Law:

I suspend the Sitting until twelve o'clock.
12 noon.

4 p.m.

p.i: The following Members took and subscribed the Oath, or made and subscribed the Affirmation required by Law:

speech.p: Woodrow Lyle Wyatt, esquire, Bosworth.
Alice Cullen, Glasgow, Gorbals.

Arthur Davidson, esquire, Accrington.
Resolved, That this House do now adjourn till Tomorrow at twenty-five minutes past Eleven o'clock.—[Mr. Harper.]

p.i: Adjourned accordingly at a quarter past Four o'clock.
